1935-1943
PR 345Collection processed by Larry WeimerNew-York Historical SocietyNew-York Historical Society170 Central Park WestNew York, NY 10024 (212) 873-3400This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2019-02-06T19:53:53Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
New-York Historical Society
New-York Historical Society collection of prints from the Works Progress Administration, Federal Art Project
Federal Art Project
New-York Historical Society
PR 345
3.5 Linear feet in one box and one flat file folder
1935-1943 The collection includes fifteen prints produced by fourteen artists in connection with the Works Progress Administration's Federal Art Project (1935-1943), specifically from New York City.
Accruals Note
Additional related prints may be acquired by purchase or donation in the future and added to the collection.
Arrangement Note
The collection is arranged by artist name.
Biographical/Historical Note
The Federal Art Project (1935-1943) was a Depression-era relief program run by the Works Progress Administration. The art project employed thousands of artists across the United States to create paintings, murals, photographs, and other art forms for the public. This collection includes a relatively small number of the thousands of "portable" works, specifically prints from New York City, created during the program.
Access Restrictions
Open to qualified researchers.
Use Restrictions
Permission to reproduce any Print Room holdings through publication must be obtained from: Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 270. Fax: (212) 579-8794.
Immediate Source of Acquisition Note
The prints were purchased over time by N-YHS. Dates for each are noted in the container list.
Processing Information Note
The collection was initially processed by archivist Larry Weimer in December 2017. The collection was formed at that time, primarily by transferring prints from the Printmaker File (PR 58) into this new collection. Two prints were added in November 2018. Four prints were added in February 2019.
Related Archival Materials Note
This collection holds only prints created under the auspices of the Federal Art Project. Some of the artists included here can also be found in other N-YHS collections unrelated to the Federal Art Project. See N-YHS's Department of Prints, Photographs and Architectural Collections' Printmaker File (PR 58).
Preferred Citation Note
This collection should be cited as New-York Historical Society collection of prints from the Works Progress Administration, Federal Art Project, PR 345, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.
Scope and Contents
The collection includes 15 prints produced by 14 artists in connection with the Works Progress Administration's Federal Art Program, specifically from New York City. The specific artists and works included in the collection are detailed in the container list. Generally, the works focus on people, rather than structures or landscapes, in urban settings such as street scenes, getting tattoos, street cart sales, and searching through a garbage can.
Lithographs Prints (visual works). Woodcuts New York (N.Y.) -- Pictorial works. Barlow, Lou Berman, Sarah Botts, Hugh Burke, David Dwight, Mabel Eichenberg, Fritz Gottlieb, Harry, 1895-1992 Jacobi, Eli Markham, Kyra Miller, Grambs Nooney, Ann Parish, Betty Waldo, 1910-1986 Schardt, Bernard P., 1904-1979 Velonis, Anthony, 1911-1997
